sub_topic: Finding the maximum flow in a network.
message_1:
Consider the following network:

![Image of network](https://i.imgur.com/Qh7pYK1.png)

Calculate the maximum flow that can be sent from node S to node T.
message_2:
To find the maximum flow from node S to node T, we can use the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm. We will find augmenting paths and update the residual capacities until no more augmenting paths can be found.

1. Initial flow: 0

2. Find an augmenting path: S -> A -> D -> T

   Update the residual capacities:
   - S -> A: 3/3
   - A -> D: 3/3
   - D -> T: 3/3

   Current flow: 3

3. Find an augmenting path: S -> B -> D -> T

   Update the residual capacities:
   - S -> B: 3/3
   - B -> D: 3/3
   - D -> T: 6/6

   Current flow: 6

4. Find an augmenting path: S -> A -> B -> E -> T

   Update the residual capacities:
   - S -> A: 4/4
   - A -> B: 1/1
   - B -> E: 1/1
   - E -> T: 1/1

   Current flow: 7

5. No more augmenting paths can be found.

The maximum flow from node S to node T is 7.
